Care Curriculum Sheet                                              Academics                   Home > Academics > Graduate > MS > Overview > Advanced Practice Nursing: Adult Primary Care                                                                                     < Back Master of Science Program in Advanced Practice Nursing: Adult Primary Care Program Highlights     Innovative academic and clinical preparation in primary care of adult and older adult clients in various outpatient and community settings   Focus on collaborative interprofessional care models essential for the delivery of primary care to diverse populations   Focus on the care of vulnerable populations and reduction of health disparities   Direct contact with expert primary care faculty   NYU Faculty Practice initiatives provide mentoring opportunities for students in faculty clinical practice sites implementing pioneering nurse practitioner roles   Eligibility to sit for the ANCC or AANP Adult NP Certification Exam       Program Requirements: 51 credits, 875 clinical hours   Courses                Nursing Core ( 9 credits) Mental Health Nursing                                                                                     < Back Advanced Certificate Program in Advanced Practice Nursing: Mental Health Nursing Program Highlights     Innovative academic and clinical preparation in advanced practice adult psychiatric-mental health nursing across the lifespan   Opportunity to develop subspecialty expertise in substance related disorders   Direct collaboration with nationally and internationally renowned faculty in the field of psychiatric-mental health nursing and substance related disorders   Participate in spearheading innovative social change   Graduates of this program are eligible for the ANCC Family and Mental Health Nurse Practitioner Certification Examination       Program Requirements: 12-36 credits, 750 clinical hours   Courses                Advanced Practice Core (15 credits)                                                                                     NURSE-GN 2020               Advanced Pathophysiology Across the Lifespan I              (3)             Fall                      NURSE-GN 2022               Advanced Pathophysiology Across the Lifespan II              (3)             Spring                      NURSE-GN 2012               Advanced Physical Assessment Across the Lifespan              (3)             Fall, Spring                      NURSE-GN 2021               Clinical Pharmacotherapeutics Across the Lifespan              (3)             Fall, Spring                      NURSE-GN 2013               Contemporary Clinical Practice: Advanced Practice Roles              (3)             Spring, Summer                  Population Component - Psychiatric-Mental Health (21 credits)                                                                                     NURSE-GN 2136               Mental Health I: Individual Psychotherapy Across the Lifespan              (3)             Fall                      NURSE-GN 2137               Mental Health II: Foundation of Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Across the Lifespan              (3)             Spring                      NURSE-GN 2138               Mental Health III: Group, Couple, and Family Psychotherapy Across the Lifespan              (3)             Summer                      NURSE-GN 2139               Mental Health IV: Adult and Geriatric Psychiatric Advanced Practice                     NURSE-GN 2142               Mental Health VII: Child and Adolescent Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Practicum and Supervision              (3)             Spring Rosedale ,                  PhD, PMHNP-BC ,       Assistant Professor,               mtr3@nyu.edu                               Practicum Opportunities                   Pioneering clinical placements in diverse urban settings   Premier teaching hospital centers (e.g., Mt. Sinai Medical Center, NYU Langone Medical Center, Bellevue, Bronx Lebanon, Gouverneur Hospital)   Select private practice offices or community-based practice sites supportive of Psychiatric Nursing Practitioner role development   All placements are arranged by faculty   Placement possibilities are available throughout the tri-state area       Gainful Employment Disclosure               Attachment Size     Advanced Certificate Mental Health Curriculum Sheet 36.67 KB                          Graduate            MS MS Program Policies     Advanced Certificate Advanced Practice Nursing: Geriatrics Focus on Interprofessional Primary Care for Older Adults with Multiple Chronic Conditions   Advanced Practice Nursing: Palliative Care     Dual Degree BS/MS   Dual Degree MS/MPH   DNP   PhD PhD Admissions Policies   PhD Program Policies     Compare DNP and PhD   Non-Degree                            Back to top                                                    Contact   Academic Bulletin   Open Positions   Site Map   NYU College of Dentistry   Legal   Site Credits

Mental Health V: Adult and Geriatric Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Pracitum and Supervision | NYU College of Nursing                                Home   College Directory   Global   News                                           Menu     Search                                                      About   Academics   Admissions   Research   Our Practices   Students   Alumni                                     Sections                                          Undergraduate   Graduate   Clinical Experience   Academic Calendars   Academic Integrity   Academic Affairs   Technical Standards                                     Academics                   Home > Academics                                                                       < Back  Mental Health V: Adult and Geriatric Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nursing Pracitum and Supervision                      NURSE-GN 2140, 3 Credits, (Fall)  This practicum and supervision course focuses on the application and integration of knowledge and skills essential to the care of diverse adult and geriatric clients with complex mental health problems. The practicum provides opportunities for students to refine their clinical competencies in psychiatric assessment, differential diagnoses, case conceptualization, treatment planning, psychotherapeutic and psychopharmacological interventions and outcome measures with credentialed preceptors at mental health facilities. The supervision allows students to further develop self-awareness, critical thinking, sound judgment, decision-making and leadership skills essential to advanced practice psychiatric nursing.
